comment.author: 29056926@N02
comment._content: Compare with Brooklyn's shot. Taken from a second-floor in the entrance to the Electricity Building. Note the electric lights and the column on the right. Also, we're above the level of the street lamps. The figure on the right is not an oddly still pedestrian, it's the statue of Benjamin Franklin mounted in the building's entry way.

comment.author: 105254587@N06
comment._content: There is great feeling and depth to your photo The Field Museum Library, Im keen to license this photo along with a few others. Please contact me via artists@picsastock.com for details. Regards, Lendel Petersen.
